did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Correspondence written to publisher John R. Howard and his father, John T. Howard, from authors Harriet Beecher Stowe, Henry Ward Beecher, Calvin Ellis Stowe, Edward Bok, and Maria Chapman, and to Harriet Beecher Stowe from author and prominent minister, Austin Phelps.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Purchased by the Harriet Beecher Stowe Center in 2003 from Jean Larson Steck of St. Louis, MO, John R. Howard's heir. Steck had owned the letters since 1985.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: John Raymond Howard (1837-1926) was an editor, publisher, and partner in J. B. Ford & Company (1868-1876) and its successor Fords, Howard & Hulbert (1877-?), which published Henry Ward Beecher's The Christian Union. Many of Beecher's own writings as well as his sister, Harriet Beecher Stowe's novels were serialized in The Christian Union. John Raymond Howard was the son of John Tasker Howard (1808-1888), a founder of Plymouth Congregational Church in Brooklyn Heights, NY, who became a close friend of, and financial advisor to, both Henry Ward Beecher and Harriet Beecher Stowe. John Raymond Howard's mother, Susan Taylor Raymond Howard (1812-1906), was also a close friend of Harriet Beecher Stowe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: This collection consists primarily of 67 letters written by Harriet Beecher Stowe (1811-1896) to her publisher, John R. Howard ("dear Jack"), dated between the 1860s-1880s. These letters provide in-depth information about the author's family and business affairs in her later career, including discussion of articles written for The Christian Union, novels and other books, foreign editions of her novels, her public readings and lectures, and financial matters. Many letters concern the personal affairs of the Stowe and Howard families. Stowe was a close friend of Howard's father and mother. Stowe's letters were written from Amherst, Andover, Boston, Northampton Depot, and Stockbridge, MA, Hartford, CT, and Mandarin, FL, as well as other places not specified.

The collection includes three letters written to John R. Howard from Peekskill, NY by Henry Ward Beecher (1813-1887), as well as an engraving of Beecher. It also includes one letter each written by:(1) Edward W. Bok (1863-1930), editor and author, from Brooklyn, NY to John T. Howard about a memorial book on Henry Ward Beecher.(2) Maria Weston Chapman (1806-1885), abolitionist from Staten Island, NY to John R. Howard thanking him for his book.(3) Austin Phelps (1820-1890), Congregationalist minister, author and president of Andover Theological Seminary, from Andover, MA to Harriet Beecher Stowe commending her courage in writing on the controversy surrounding Lord and Lady Byron (Lady Byron Vindicated).(4) Calvin E. Stowe (1802-1886) from Mandarin, FL to John R. Howard regarding Stowe's plans to write several religious articles.(5) Harriet B. Stowe (1836-1907) to John R. Howard from Hartford, CT thanking him for his letter and "In Memoriam" book.Finally, the collection includes 29 letter photocopies.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The John R. Howard Collection consists of one box with folders arranged alphabetically by author, then chronologically within each folder.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Collections
relatedmaterial.p: The E. Bruce Kirkham Collection of annotated Harriet Beecher Stowe letter transcripts includes references to subjects in the John R. Howard Collection.Additional John R. Howard correspondence can be found in the Katharine S. Day, Philip San, and Acquisitions Collections.
